title: Composition
text: Remember that to solve g(f(x)), we need to plug in the value of f(x) into the value of $$x$$ in g(x).

title: Composition
text: We need to plug in f(x), or $$\sqrt{x}+2$$, for the $$x$$ in the function f: $${\left(\sqrt{x}+2\right)}^2+3$$.
speech: We need to plug in f(x), or  the square root of x plus 2 , for the  x  in the function f:  parentheses, the square root of x plus 2  squared plus 3 .
pacedSpeech: We need to plug in f(x), or   the square root of x plus 2
in the function f:   , the square root of x plus 2  squared plus 3

title: Exponents
text: Based off the Order of Operations, the first step is the exponent: $${\left(\sqrt{x}+2\right)}^2=x+4\left(\sqrt{x}\right)+4$$.
speech: Based off the Order of Operations, the first step is the exponent:  parentheses, the square root of x plus 2  squared is equal to x plus, 4 times, parentheses the square root of x  plus 4 .
pacedSpeech: Based off the Order of Operations, the first step is the exponent:   , the square root of x plus 2  squared is equal to x plus, 4 times,  the square root of x  plus 4

title: Addition
text: The expression now reads $$x+4\left(\sqrt{x}\right)+4+3$$. The last step is to add the constants: $$x+4\left(\sqrt{x}\right)+4+3=$$ $$x+4\left(\sqrt{x}\right)+7$$.
speech: The expression now reads  x plus, 4 times, parentheses the square root of x  plus 4 plus 3 . The last step is to add the constants:  x, plus, 4 times, parentheses the square root of x  plus 4 plus 3 is equal to   x plus, 4 times, parentheses the square root of x  plus 7 .

. The last step is to add the constants:   x, plus, 4 times,  the square root of x  plus 4 plus 3 is equal to
